item.description:

item.title: Mentioned by Hill Times (subscription)
item.description:
Aglukkaq's commitment to environment questionable, say critics
Aglukkaq's commitment to environment questionable, say critics. 'I see health and economic issues, but not really environment. I don't think just because you're from the North you necessarily know a lot about the environment,' says former Conservative MP and House Environment Committee chair Bob Mills. Photograph by Jake Wright, The Hill Times. The environment files: Leona Aglukkaq was appointed the Environment Minister on July 15. Her record on the environment worries some critics. By CHRIS PLECASH |

item.description:
Ottawa continues search in Nunavut waters for lost Franklin ships
Nunavut MP Leona Aglukkaq, Canada's environment minister and minister responsible for Parks Canada, announced Aug. 9 that Parks Canada underwater archaeologists will return to Nunavut to continue “an expedition of international significance,” the ...

item.description:
Inuk MP chosen environmental minister

item.title: Mentioned by Northern News Services (subscription)
item.description:
Nunavut MP now in charge of environment
Most notably, Nunavut MP Leona Aglukkaq becomes minister of Environment, a change from being federal minister of Health since October, 2008. She is still responsible for the Canadian Northern Economic Development Agency (CanNor) and chairperson of ...

item.title: Mentioned by Huffington Post Canada
item.description:
Leona Aglukkaq Could Be Help Or Hindrance In Environment Portfolio
OTTAWA - If there are any questions about why Leona Aglukkaq, the soft-spoken Inuk politician from Nunavut, was chosen by Stephen Harper to lead Environment Canada, the Prime Minister's Office is eager to dispel them. "As an Inuk woman, minister Aglukkaq grew up with a cultural ... Aglukkaq also played on her ancestry to shoot down a Liberal MP's question about health care funding cuts for diabetes, suicide prevention and aboriginal health staff. "Can the minister explain to this House why her cuts target the ...
